skillTree.localised_description: The god of money, wealth and power protects it's patrons with a shield of coins.
The Lord Harbourmaster has information on all major ports, the best ways to enter and which approach to take.

effects.description:
Cost of Caravan Shortcut event: -20%
	(accompanying Lord)

skillTree.localised_description: The Lord Harbourmaster decided where ships may dock, a powerful position within Marienburg. Since for the right permits one needs to pass his office.
It is one thing to take sufficient supplies to sea, the true genius knows how to gather supplies whilst at sea.
No ships are allowed to dock unless they bare the seal of Marienburger equipment, of course only to be acquired in one of Luydenhoek's many shops.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 when fighting at sea
	(Hero's army)

Immune to High Seas, Reef and Storm attrition
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Math and seamenship hold many similarities, the davisquadrant for example allows for precise navigating, traversing distances in the outmost efficient manor.
Luydenhoek is known for it's many warehouses, with a variety of dry, wet and flammeable goods.
The Harbourmaster is often a former veteran sailor, and Odvaal is no exemption - his many years a sea has equipped him with numerous skills.

effects.description:
Speed: +8% for all missile units
	(Hero's army)

Melee attack: +8 when fighting at sea
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Bruynwater is known for it's muddy canals and numerous orphanages, this ragged district delivers hardened soldiers - their symbol a brass anchor.
His office a revered location, a palace of commerce and nepotism. All port calls need the Harbourmaster's explicit approval, which is hard to come by without the appropriate bribe.
Strompoort a mighty bastion with cannons faced seawards, striking fear in the hearths of hostile fleets.
Odvaal sailed the four corners, and who would have thought being able to plot a precicse course would benefit one in battle.
At Baron Henryk's school students learn to fire precise even when faced with the challanges of a rolling sea.
The Lucky Loon is Odvaal's favorite tavern, Helga's brew would lift even the most dampened of spirits.
A Lookout know's exactly what to scoure the sea's fear, spotting danger before it presents itself.
The Lord Harbourmaster has a busy schedule and the outmost sense of timing. One would dare wonder if his watch holds magic properties.
Nothing to encourage a sailor than messages from home, or drawings even..
Odvaal hails from the Stoessel district, known for it's flamboyant residents. Do not mistake their stride for weakness, as Stoesselaren are excellent swordfighters.
A role as important as that of Lord Harbourmaster comes with excellent attire.
Although not disabled, Odvaal hides a hook in his coat, painted with the finest ornaments. It is almost as if he's waiting for the day he loses a hand.
From Rijker's Isle comes a strange brew of powder, with dwarvish and empiric elements mixed in to one explosive combination - all fitted in a single bullet.
Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

effects.description: Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 5%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 10%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: "I am not here to inspire, I am here to kill - come let us draw blades together!"

effects.description: Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 3%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 8%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: Trade and investment are the pillars of development.

effects.description: Increase Trade action: Tradable resource production increased by an additional +6%
Increase Trade action: Tradable resource production increased by an additional +16%
Increase Trade action: Tradable resource production increased by an additional +30%

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.

items.colour_text: There are many ceremonial duties tied to the role of Lord Harbourmaster, yet this does not mean it's all symbolical. The Lord Harbourmaster is gifted a roe by the directorate by tradition. This piece of equipment holds the names of all Harbourmasters, carved on to both sides of it's marvelous elvish wood. It's engraved with gold from the mines of Karak Hirn and it takes no appraiser to see it holds magical properties. Although not legendary by nature, the Harbourmaster's Roe is a tool to be reckoned with.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 when fighting at sea
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Lord Harbourmaster is an important figure amongst Marienburger society, holding the strings for both merchant vessels and the local merchants all the same.
